intro: Borreria trichantha, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Borreria trichantha is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
